TopicTitle: For Bronies! A flag for your game!

Articles.Content:
I made this flag design for the bronies of the community! Enjoy!

(Also, if this is was posted in the wrong section, I'm sorry. If anyone knows where this would go otherwise, please tell me and I'll re-post it.)

Edited May 25, 2013 by Stormman3100
Equestria has a space program now eh? I'm down with that. Does not look half bad, though the font leaves something to be desired. I think I'll put one outside of my new Mun Base. PNY Base 02
I'd rather have the banner of Unicornia

I'll just have to break out the Krakensbane antimatter missile, won't I? Alright, here goes:

*thread is obliterated*

However, this is better than anything I will ever draw.

Come on now Halocon, surely you can appreciate the style and moderation here, its not Hot pink with cupcakes and rainbows now is it? Granted Pink does not actuality exist in the natural color spectrum and Cupcakes and rainbows are always good, especially if your eating cupcakes at a picnic in view of a rainbow. That would be epic.

Edited May 26, 2013 by Chrono

Hey Stormman, I don't really have a problem with this being posted, but others might. The moderators have specified that all MLP content be contained to this thread. No worries, as it's easy to see how you could get mixed up.

Come on now Halocon, surely you can appreciate the style and moderation here, its not Hot pink with cupcakes and rainbows now is it? Granted Pink does not actuality exist in the natural color spectrum and Cupcakes and rainbows are always good, especially if your eating cupcakes at a picnic in view of a rainbow. That would be epic.

Exactly! I'm a Brony (I hate the term Pegasister... just seems really sexist to me) and I'm very much proud of the fandom I'm a member of (despite Hasbro ****ing all the loyal fans over recently.....)

You can mock the show as much as you want, but just remember, Halo is just as silly to me
Yeah, I didn't know haha. I will move this over there now. I apologize.
^^ this guy is awesome

You can mock the show as much as you want, but just remember, Halo is just as silly to me

You did not just say that. Now you're gonna say that Half-Life or Fallout are silly.
So long as you call things I like silly, I'll sling it right back at things you like.

Im scared of chobit's pointing finger - makes me feel like I broke the switch, not Jeb!

Anyway, heres a crappy flag:

So long as you call things I like silly, I'll sling it right back at things you like.

I never said Bronism was silly. In fact, My Little Pony is certainly alot better than some of the schlock companies like Cartoon Network put out. Rather, it what you said was silly. Halo is not silly. It isn't exactly perfect (seriously, why does Reach's singleplayer suck so much) but like My Little Pony, it's alot better than, oh lets see, Wolfenstein, but not as good as New VegasÃ¢â‚¬â€¹.

Edited June 12, 2013 by MGUARN

To all bronies/pegasisters- grow up

MLP was meant for girls under the age of 10 back in 2007-ish

It was not meant for 13+ year old boys/men in 2013

In my honest opinion, MLP should have been canceled and ground into the dust years ago, so that it wouldn't result in the downgraded maturity of teenage boys.

And also, why be scared of chobit-389?

He (yes, he) was banned for good, so he won't bother you. Also, if you really mull over his art, its really just manga people painted green. Not exactly what a Kerbal looks like from my point of view. In the end, chobit-389 was just an overly critical and extremely over reactive poster who had it coming.

To all bronies/pegasisters- grow up

MLP was meant for girls under the age of 10 back in 2007-ish

It was not meant for 13+ year old boys/men in 2013

In my honest opinion, MLP should have been canceled and ground into the dust years ago, so that it wouldn't result in the downgraded maturity of teenage boys.

Congratulations! You just got the Dumbass Of The Week award!

Your entire argument is folly, people can like what they like and if MLP is liked by someone, that's entirely their thing. It does not effect you (no matter how much you whine and moan about someone publicly announcing that they like MLP) and neither does this thread. You see it's for bronies and if you are not a brony and do not like the show, what in Hawking's name are you even doing here? Do you think your "mighty words of wisdom" which basically just blatantly insult everyone who's ever watched and liked MLP will ever turn someone from the show and make them see what you percieve as "the truth"? Heck no! It'll just make them laugh at you or it will make some of them pissy and they will tell you to bug off if you don't like the same thing they do.

But you don't find it creepy at all that adult males (21+) like the show?

That doesn't strike you as a little odd?

Also MLP has leaked over into other things that were completely fine without it, Examples including but not limited to: Back to the Future, Doctor Who, TF 2, KSP, and Minecraft.

In the end, MLP has contributed nothing to society except proving how mature (or immature) some people are. At least I take comfort in knowing that I have an IQ level and maturity level higher than a 21+ year old bronie.

But you don't find it creepy at all that adult males (21+) like the show?

That doesn't strike you as a little odd?

Also MLP has leaked over into other things that were completely fine without it, Examples including but not limited to: Back to the Future, Doctor Who, TF 2, KSP, and Minecraft.

In the end, MLP has contributed nothing to society except proving how mature (or immature) some people are. At least I take comfort in knowing that I have an IQ level and maturity level higher than a 21+ year old bronie.

And with that sentance you have just proven how the polar opposite is true.

The thing about maturity is that when you're mature, you don't suddenly stop liking the things you like, they just stop being the most important things in life (because their place is taken by things such as job security, rent money et cetera). A lot of people who are fans are entirely adult and mature personalities, they just happen to like a thing and are not afraid of showing it.

Also, "MLP has contributed nothing to society and has proven how mature or immature some people are"? You, my dear sir, have never heard of the charity events the brony fandom organises in order to spread the virtues the show promotes. They give things to charity, help in soup kitchens, make donations and just all around volunteer to do good deeds. If that is not a way in which the mere presence of MLP has contributed at least something to society, then I don't know what is. The only people it has proven immature is the masses of people who can't shut up about how much they hate everything MLP related and who constantly whine about how bad it is instead of doing the mature thing, which is acknowledging that they don't like the show and moving on with their life.

As for the creepiness factor, a lot of adults like Adventure Time, the Transformers, TMNT and Kirby, all of which have been developed for and marketed to children, but are still widely enjoyed by children and adults everywhere. So, no, I do not find it creepy that a group of full-grown men like a thing originally meant for children. If you are going to make a comment on pornography, I shall remind you in advance about the infamous rule 34, which states that mere existance of the item dictates the coexistance of pornography of that item. No exceptions.

The thing about MLP leaking over to other things that were "completely fine without it" are mostly limited only to bronies who happen to enjoy that thing as well and also has no effect on anyone but them. Not to mention that joining two items of popular culture has been a mainstay of popular culture for a long before MLP came around. Look at all the things Star Trek has spread into with fan fictions, drawings et all over the last half a century of its existance. Take another look at comic books wherein crossovers are incredibly popular and happen incredibly often, to much joy or dismay of some of the fans.

As for you taking comfort that you have a higher IQ level and are more mature than your average brony: Just by claiming that you are smarter than a person who takes no shame in enjoying what they like you have proven that you are, in fact, not mature at all. The fact that you have a higher IQ has been denied by your obvious lack of research into the topic and the tendency to make grand, sweeping statements, most of which are incorrect.

I'm disgusted by the macho mentality and the advertising of gore and all that stupid crap that's the industry trying to label as "male", but not only I find bronies a bit odd, but exactly "people with sanity problems".

The cartoon is tailored for small children and is tailored for small female children, where "female" stands for the gender, not the sex.

Basically, the stuff is made for the stereotype of little girls. The only ones who are stereotyping here is the industry that made the cartoon.

I find adult males engaging in this stuff basically childlish. The female stuff is just an additional weirdo factor and a rather large one.

I do not hate true bronies (to clarify, there are some of them who do it ironically), but nobody can convince me they are sane. It's a problem with physchological development as you grow up.

I honestly tried to watch it and I was baffled by it. This or any girly cartoon, doesn't matter.
Someone mentioned something innocuous about My Little Pony on a non-brony website?

Come on now Halocon, surely you can appreciate the style and moderation here, its not Hot pink with cupcakes and rainbows now is it? Granted Pink does not actuality exist in the natural color spectrum and Cupcakes and rainbows are always good, especially if your eating cupcakes at a picnic in view of a rainbow. That would be epic.

I'd like to request a version of this in hot pink with cupcakes and rainbows. Seriously, make it happen.

Oh, and sprinkles.

Ooh, I know, streamers!

Someone mentioned something innocuous about My Little Pony on a non-brony website?

Don't get too excited

Also, rainbow is the most fabulous colour of them all.

Yeah, It seems that spit back there was as exciting as it's going to get.

Now that I'm here though, I'll just say that the brony fandom has me endlessly perplexed, in no small part because of the hostility towards them too.

We need more KSP fans in the world, surely we can all agree on that at least.

What the hell is with this obsession with "Bronies"? I have always thought that the only people who would appreciate scary pony cartoons would be pedophiles.. But Bah, Who am I kidding, ALL Of the cartoons these days are really.. How Do I put this.. Stupid. Just stupid.

But again, Im the 15 year old kid that watches documentaries instead of cartoons.. OR robot chicken and family guy. Either way,

Lets agree to disagree.

-Bobhendly

Edited October 24, 2013 by Bobhendly
I Like Cheese.

scary pony cartoons

-Bobhendly

You're scared of ponies? Tell me more about how manly you are.
